definition[0]: the fact that a place or product is so expensive that not many people can afford to buy it
example[0]: Porsche highlighted its exclusivity by aiming at the high end of the luxury-car segment.
definition[1]: the fact of having an exclusive agreement, contract, or right
example[1]: The manufacturer will have seven-year marketing exclusivity for the drug.
definition[2]: when a business that is in the process of being bought agrees not to speak to any other person or company that may be interested in buying it
